locsearch.evaluation package¶

Submodules¶

locsearch.evaluation.abstract_evaluation_function module¶

class locsearch.evaluation.abstract_evaluation_function.AbstractEvaluationFunction¶

Bases: abc.ABC

Template to create evaluation functions.

Evaluationfunctions are used to determine the quality of a solution.

delta_evaluate(other_solution, current_solution)¶

Evaluates the difference in quality between two solutions.

This function does not need to be implemented. One should only consider to implement and use it if a delta evaluation is faster than the regular evaluate function or if it needs to be implemented to work with existing code.

Parameters:
  • other_solution (AbstractSolution) – The Solution that is evaluated.
  • current_solution (AbstractSolution) – The Solution that other_solution is compared to.
Returns:

the difference in quality between other_solution and current_solution. Note that this is equivalent to evaluate(other_solution)-evaluate(current_solution).
Return type:

int or float
evaluate(current_solution)¶

Evaluates current_solution

Parameters:current_solution (AbstractSolution) – The Solution to be evaluated
Returns:an indication of the quality of current_solution
Return type:int or float

locsearch.evaluation.tsp_evaluation_function module¶

class locsearch.evaluation.tsp_evaluation_function.TspEvaluationFunction(distance_matrix)¶

Bases: locsearch.evaluation.abstract_evaluation_function.AbstractEvaluationFunction

This class contains the methods to evaluate the quality of a tsp-solution

Parameters:distance_matrix (numpy.ndarray) – The distance matrix of the tsp-problem. The weight from A to B does not need to be equal to the weight from B to A.
distance_matrix¶

The distance matrix of the tsp-problem.

Type:numpy.ndarray
size¶

the amount of points to visit

Type:int

Examples

A simple example:

>>> import numpy
>>> from locsearch.evaluation.tsp_evaluation_function import TspEvaluationFunction
>>> dist_matrix = numpy.array(
... [[0, 2, 9, 5],
...  [2, 0, 4, 6],
...  [9, 4, 0, 3],
...  [5, 6, 3, 0]])
>>> eval_func = TspEvaluationFunction(dist_matrix)
>>> order = numpy.array([0, 1, 2, 3])
>>> eval_func.evaluate(order)
14
>>> order = numpy.array([0, 3, 1, 2])
>>> eval_func.evaluate(order)
24
>>> order = numpy.array([2, 0, 1, 3])
>>> eval_func.evaluate(order)
20
delta_evaluate(other_solution, current_solution)¶

Evaluates the difference in quality between two solutions.

This function does not need to be implemented. One should only consider to implement and use it if a delta evaluation is faster than the regular evaluate function or if it needs to be implemented to work with existing code.

Parameters:
  • other_solution (AbstractSolution) – The Solution that is evaluated.
  • current_solution (AbstractSolution) – The Solution that other_solution is compared to.
Returns:

the difference in quality between other_solution and current_solution. Note that this is equivalent to evaluate(other_solution)-evaluate(current_solution).
Return type:

int or float
evaluate(order)¶

Calculates an evaluation value for the function

Parameters:order (numpy.ndarray) – A 1 dimensional array that contains the order of the points to visit. All values are unique and are within the interval [0,size[.
